vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
τρῆμα, ατος, τό,
(τετραίνω) perforation, aperture, orifice, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; τ. τυφλόν the foramen caecum in the skull, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; τῆς ἀρτηρίας, [τοῦ αἰδοίου], [Refs 4th c.BC+]; the hole in the beam of a balance, [Refs]
__2 ={τρύπημα}, obscene meaning, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II of the holes or pips of dice, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
hole, eye (of a needle)
Some manuscripts list τρυμαλιά (G5168) in place of G6085 at Luk.18.25
